revised_title: Investigating the Structure of the Nuclear Membrane in Amphibian Oocyte Nuclei
tldr: The authors investigate the structure of the nuclear membrane in amphibian oocyte nuclei using electron microscopy. They discover that the nuclear membrane consists of two layers, an outer porous layer and an inner layer, and provide insights into their composition and arrangement. This study contributes to the understanding of the nuclear membrane's structure and properties in various cells.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
